1:
[{"page":"BMI Calculator Page", 
"functions":[
{"function":"Select Unit of Measurement", "description":"Allows user to select whether to enter weight and height in metric (kg, m) or imperial units (lbs, inches)"},
{"function":"Input Weight", "description":"Enables users to input their current weight"},
{"function":"Input Height", "description":"Provides field where users can input their current height"},
{"function":"Calculate BMI", "description":"Automatically computes user's body mass index based on the provided measurements and displays the result in a formatted output, including categories indicating whether the user is underweight, normal weight, overweight or obese"},
{"function":"View BMI Categories","description":"Shows a chart outlining BMI categories according to WHO recommendations: underweight (less than 18.5), normal weight (18.5-24.9), overweight (25-29.9), and obesity (30 and above)"},
{"function":"Display Interactive Chart", "description":"Optional function that could optionally display user's inputted measurements on a interactive chart illustrating how their BMI has changed over time or against average population values"},
{"function":"Clear All Fields", "description":"Reset functionality to allow users to re-input new measurements without retaining any previous data."}]
)]

functions.description: Import pandas, numpy, and statsmodels to handle data and perform logistic regression.
Use pandas to read the "Gamedata.xlsx" file into a DataFrame.

functions.function: Lag dependent variable by one period
functions.description: Create new column in the DataFrame with the 'result' lagged by one period.

functions.function: Drop unnecessary columns or rows (if any)
functions.description: Remove any extra columns or rows that are not needed for modeling.
Use statsmodels to create a logistic regression model with the shifted 'result' as the dependent variable, and all other variables as independent variables.

functions.function: Fit the model to the data
functions.description: Run the model using the provided data to fit it to the observed outcomes.

functions.function: Output model summary to Excel file
functions.description: Use pandas and ExcelWriter to save the model's summary statistics to "Logistic.xlsx" file in a clear format.
